Media.MediaTitle: brain, lateral and medial, child, anatomy

OriginalSource.Creator: Terese Winslow
OriginalSource.Comment: Removed the “Tentorium” label from the image panel
Diversity update: updated the skin tone of the figures in both panels to FP Type IV (light brown skin)
Revised image; added new label to right panel: Midbrain
Added new labels to right panel: Supratentorial area, Posterior fossa/infratentorial area, Tectum, Fourth ventricle, Third ventricle, and Lateral ventricle

ContentDescriptions.ContentDescription: Anatomy of the brain; the right panel shows the supratentorial area (the upper part of the brain) and the posterior fossa/infratentorial area (the lower back part of the brain). The supratentorial area contains the cerebrum, lateral ventricle and third ventricle (with cerebrospinal fluid shown in blue), choroid plexus, pineal gland, hypothalamus, pituitary gland, and optic nerve. The posterior fossa/infratentorial area contains the cerebellum, tectum, fourth ventricle, and brain stem (midbrain, pons, and medulla). The spinal cord is also shown. The left panel shows the cerebrum, ventricles (fluid-filled spaces), meninges, skull, cerebellum, brain stem (pons and medulla), and spinal cord.

Captions.MediaCaption: Anatomy of the brain. The supratentorial area (the upper part of the brain) contains the cerebrum, lateral ventricle and third ventricle (with cerebrospinal fluid shown in blue), choroid plexus, pineal gland, hypothalamus, pituitary gland, and optic nerve. The posterior fossa/infratentorial area (the lower back part of the brain) contains the cerebellum, tectum, fourth ventricle, and brain stem (midbrain, pons, and medulla). The skull and meninges protect the brain and spinal cord.

ProposedUse.Summary: Childhood Central Nervous System Atypical Teratoid/Rhabdoid Tumor Treatment
